news_header: Pope Francis is recovering from pneumonia, with stable heart function, while discussions about his potential resignation arise.
news_original_title: Pope Francis is out of bed, eating and working at hospital while recovering from pneumonia
news_text: Pope Francis' health is reportedly improving as he battles pneumonia, with stable heart parameters and no fever. Hospitalized since February 14, he faces challenges due to his age and previous health issues. Despite concerns about his ability to fulfill papal duties, church leaders affirm that the Catholic Church remains active. Discussions about potential resignation, similar to Pope Benedict XVI's decision, have emerged, but there is no indication that Francis is incapacitated. He continues to work from his hospital room, showing signs of slight improvement. Church officials express confidence in his recovery, recalling his resilience during past challenges.
